intro: Siphonoglossa nummularia, commonly known as the silver dollar plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are typically silver or gray in color, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It prefers well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Siphonoglossa nummularia is relatively low maintenance and drought-tolerant once established.
